case_title: THE STATE and others vs RAHIM DAD and others
reference_no_or_id: Murder Reference No.30 of 2002, Criminal Jail Appeal No.72 of 2002, Criminal Appeals Nos.73, 76 of 2002 (ATA), Criminal Acquittal Appeal No.89 of 2002 (ATA)
complaint_summary: Minor Ambreen was abducted from her home in Quetta, and Muhammad Ayub was murdered during the abduction. A ransom demand of Rs. 1 crore was made, later negotiated to Rs. 30 lacs.
investigation_summary: Police arrested Muhammad Afzal in Afghanistan after he received the ransom money. Minor Ambreen was recovered. Other accused were arrested based on disclosures and evidence.
judgment_summary: Appellants Fayyaz Ahmad alias Kaka Marri, Rahim Dad, and Muhammad Afzal were convicted for abduction and sentenced to life imprisonment. Absconding accused were acquitted due to lack of evidence.
punishment: Life imprisonment for Fayyaz Ahmad alias Kaka Marri, Rahim Dad, and Muhammad Afzal; Rs. 100,000 fine each.
Decision_or_verdict: Conviction upheld for Fayyaz Ahmad alias Kaka Marri, Rahim Dad, and Muhammad Afzal. Acquittal of absconding accused confirmed.
legal_arguments: Confessions made to police inadmissible under Qanoon-e-Shahadat Order.
Identification parade of Rahim Dad valid and credible.
Anonymous letters allegedly written by Muhammad Afzal not proven.

witness_statement.Shafique Ahmad Khan: Reported the abduction and murder incident.
witness_statement.Faqir Muhammad: Identified Rahim Dad during identification parade.
witness_statement.Laila: Identified Rahim Dad as one of the abductors.
witness_statement.Ambreen: Identified Rahim Dad as one of the abductors.
witness_statement.Abdul Rahim: Delivered ransom money and witnessed arrest of Muhammad Afzal.
witness_statement.Muhammad Illyas: Provided pistol used in the crime.

key_issues: Admissibility of confessions made to police
Recovery of abductee and ransom money

maxims.Admissibility of Evidence: Confessions made to police are inadmissible unless leading to discovery of facts.

words_and_phrases.Ransom: Money demanded for release of abductee.

summary_vector_notes: Case involves abduction of minor Ambreen and murder of Muhammad Ayub. Convictions based on credible identification and recovery of ransom money. Absconding accused acquitted due to lack of evidence.

abduction_details.location: Zia House, Amirabad, Tail Godown, Quetta
abduction_details.culprits: Entered through kitchen door, forcibly abducted Ambreen, killed Muhammad Ayub (shopkeeper)

inadmissible_evidence: Statements under section 164 Cr.P.C. not examined in trial court
Anonymous letters allegedly written by Muhammad Afzal
valid_evidence: Ballistic match of empties and pistol recovered from Muhammad Illyas

identification_parade.Rahim_Dad: Identified by Ambreen, Laila, and Faqir Muhammad
